instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a that cutomer changed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. No liquid damage, as he says just display randomly was shutting down. Changed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> again with new one  ( it wasnt soldered good). The machine still not turning on. Green light ok. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 2.2V and almost shorted to ground with 11ohms ground resistance. 


With magsafe contected <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> is getting warm enough. Already checked ISL 625 and 17/18 and 27/28 resistance seems to be ok. Also resistance in that area. 

I guess that when was changind <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> first time heated up too much and fucked GPU. CHecking in that area doesnt see anything strange. 

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message: This now has a dead GPU or CPU shorting PPBUS to ground. This one is done. You can confirm by measuring resistance between the PPBUS fuse and the CPU/GPU coils

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message: Resistance between F7040 PIn 2 and L8360 ( i think this u mean with GPU coil) is 190 ohms and with L8310 390 Ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message: what is the normal resistance value? I have 3 logic board like that all 3 dead but they all giving different values. from 300ohms upt to 3mhoms between F7040 and L8360

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on F7040 and L8930/60; there is GPU VCORE.
You can also remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and check if <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has then correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message: Customer doesnt want to wait. So thanks for help, Macbook was given to it's owner.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on
threads.message: For the best they fucked it not worth the time
